alert.note: Alert for Sonoma (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 14 at 5:41PM PDT until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: .Creek gauges such as the Mark West Creek, Green Valley Creek, Colgan Creek, and other small streams in interior Sonoma County are still in flood stage. While rain has ended they will remain elevated overnight. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following county, Sonoma. * WHEN...Until 900 AM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 540 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated an area of very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Rosa, Rohnert Park, Sebastopol, Cotati, Forestville and Graton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
